etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 员(員) (yuán, "member") = people who are members of a group -> personnel; staff
etymology.interpretation: The word 人员(人員) (rényuán, "personnel; staff") signifies individuals who collectively form the members of an organization or team. This directly reflects its use to refer to staff or personnel in various contexts.

examples.chinese: 公司需要人员(公司需要人員)，来帮助公司发展(來幫助公司發展)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī xūyào rényuán, lái bāngzhù gōngsī fāzhǎn.
examples.english: The company needs personnel to help develop the business.

examples.chinese: 训练有素的人员(訓練有素的人員)，确保工程质量(確保工程質量)。
examples.pinyin: Xùnliàn yǒusù de rényuán, quèbǎo gōngchéng zhìliàng.
examples.english: Well-trained personnel ensure the quality of the project.

examples.chinese: 在紧急情况下(在緊急情況下)，专业人员迅速到达现场(專業人員迅速到達現場)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jǐnjí qíngkuàng xià, zhuānyè rényuán xùnsù dàodá xiànchǎng.
examples.english: In emergency situations, professional personnel quickly arrive at the scene.
